elements.content: A magnetisation and Mössbauer study of triazole (M1−x2+Mx3+)M3+F5(Htaz)1−x(taz)x weberites (M = Fe, Co, Mn, Zn, Ga, V)† M. Albino L. Clark J. Lhoste C. Payen J.-M. Grenèche P. Lightfoot V. Maisonneuve and M. Leblanc 1,23,456789,1011,12131415161718192021222324Crystal structure of (Fe0.962+Fe0.043+)Fe3+F5(Htaz)0.96(taz)0.04 (left). Fe2+ and Fe3+ cation connectivity (right).Magnetic connectivity in (M1−x2+Mx3+)M3+F5(Htaz)1−x(taz)x compounds: 0D or 1D with M2+ (yellow octahedra) or M3+ (green octahedra) paramagnetic cations, respectively, and 3D when both cations are paramagnetic. The dotted circle in the bottom right figure shows a frustrated M–M–M triangle.

A magnetisation and Mössbauer study of triazole (M1-x2+Mx3+)M3+F5(Htaz)1-x(taz)x weberites (M = Fe, Co, Mn, Zn, Ga, V)†

Crystal structure of (Fe0.962+Fe0.043+)Fe3+F5(Htaz)0.96(taz)0.04 (left). Fe2+ and Fe3+ cation connectivity (right).

Magnetic connectivity in (M1-x2+Mx3+)M3+F5(Htaz)1-x(taz)x compounds: 0D or 1D with M2+ (yellow octahedra) or M3+ (green octahedra) paramagnetic cations, respectively, and 3D when both cations are paramagnetic. The dotted circle in the bottom right figure shows a frustrated M-M-M triangle.

elements.content: Fig. 2 Magnetic connectivity in (M1−x2+Mx3+)M3+F5(Htaz)1−x(taz)x compounds: 0D or 1D with M2+ (yellow octahedra) or M3+ (green octahedra) paramagnetic cations, respectively, and 3D when both cations are paramagnetic. The dotted circle in the bottom right figure shows a frustrated M–M–M triangle.

The dotted circle in the bottom right figure shows a frustrated M-M-M triangle.
